damn... do you really know me that well already? you got it tho. number 3. 
work for $$$


----Original Message Follows----
No, that's good. It is common sense that you wouldn't want to kill the 
guards, but by saying that, that means that you're a native to Jakarta-town.
I can't say this is really a question, because basically it's going to 
depend upon how the storyline advances, but if you are an assassin in 
Jakarta town, that leaves you three choices:
1. You work for the Saervii. Now since the Saervii have been information 
gathering until now, you've been lying dormant awaiting your first mission.
2. You work for Jakarta. You're anti-rebellion working under Shifter (the 
man in white at the start of chapter 3) This makes you a bad guy that we'll 
probably have to kill, since you're pretty much unbribable.
3. You're independant. [I KNOW YOU'RE GOING TO WANT THIS ONE, COME ON, ADMIT 
IT! :D] Whether you've been here for a few weeks, or most of your life, you 
dont owe allegiance to anyone, and you've done odd jobs for the Saervii 
and/or Jakarta. If there was some way of influence (family member, wife, 
children get killed or somethin) then maybe we could get you over to the 
Saervii. Or you could be like Shadow from ff3 and work for money.

-Zjack
